speaker: Marcus
text: Hey, I noticed you looked a bit annoyed with how that retro went.
ipa: heɪ, aɪ ˈnoʊtɪst ju lʊkt ə bɪt əˈnɔɪd wɪð haʊ ðæt ˈrɛtroʊ wɛnt.
stress: HEY, I NOTICED you LOOKED a BIT ANNOYED with how that RETRO went.
linking:
"noticed you" → /ˈnoʊtɪst ju/ (t + y linking)
"looked a" → /lʊkt ə/ (d + a linking)

speaker: Dana
text: Yeah, I was just frustrated by the way everyone kept talking about the same problems without offering solutions.
ipa: jæ, aɪ wəz dʒəst ˈfrʌstreɪtɪd baɪ ðə weɪ ˈɛvrɪwʌn kɛpt ˈtɔkɪŋ əˈbaʊt ðə seɪm ˈprɑbləmz wɪˈðaʊt ˈɔfərɪŋ səˈluʃənz.
stress: YEAH, I was just FRUSTRATED by the way EVERYONE kept TALKING about the SAME PROBLEMS without OFFERING SOLUTIONS.
linking:
"was just" → /wəz dʒəst/ (z + j linking)
"talking about" → /ˈtɔkɪŋ əˈbaʊt/ (g + a linking)

speaker: Marcus
text: I get that. I talked to Tom earlier — he said he feels responsible for the delays this sprint.
ipa: aɪ ɡɛt ðæt. aɪ tɔkt tə tɑm ˈɝliɚ — hi sɛd hi filz rɪˈspɑnsəbl fər ðə dɪˈleɪz ðɪs sprɪnt.
stress: I GET that. I TALKED to TOM earlier — he SAID he FEELS RESPONSIBLE for the DELAYS this SPRINT.
linking:
"talked to" → /tɔkt tə/ (d + t linking)
"feels responsible" → /filz rɪˈspɑnsəbl/ (s + r linking)

speaker: Dana
text: Hmm, I wouldn’t blame him for it. Honestly, we’re all part of the problem.
ipa: hmm, aɪ ˈwʊdənt bleɪm hɪm fər ɪt. ˈɑnəstli, wɪr ɔl pɑrt əv ðə ˈprɑbləm.
stress: Hmm, I WOULDN’T BLAME him for it. HONESTLY, we’re ALL PART of the PROBLEM.
linking:
"wouldn’t blame" → /ˈwʊdənt bleɪm/ (t + b linking)
"part of" → /pɑrt əv/ (t + o linking)

speaker: Marcus
text: True. I’m actually excited about trying that new task management flow you proposed.
ipa: tru. aɪm ˈæktʃuəli ɪkˈsaɪtɪd əˈbaʊt ˈtraɪɪŋ ðæt nu tæsk ˈmænɪdʒmənt floʊ ju prəˈpoʊzd.
stress: TRUE. I’m ACTUALLY EXCITED about TRYING that NEW TASK MANAGEMENT FLOW you PROPOSED.
linking:
"excited about" → /ɪkˈsaɪtɪd əˈbaʊt/ (d + a linking)
"flow you" → /floʊ ju/ (w + y linking)

speaker: Dana
text: Thanks! I wrote to our PM about it, and she seemed interested in giving it a trial run next sprint.
ipa: θæŋks! aɪ roʊt tu aʊər pi ɛm əˈbaʊt ɪt, ənd ʃi simd ˈɪntrəstɪd ɪn ˈɡɪvɪŋ ɪt ə ˈtraɪəl rʌn nɛkst sprɪnt.
stress: THANKS! I WROTE to our PM about it, and SHE SEEMED INTERESTED in GIVING it a TRIAL RUN next SPRINT.
linking:
"wrote to" → /roʊt tu/ (t + t linking)
"giving it" → /ˈɡɪvɪŋ ɪt/ (g + i linking)

speaker: Marcus
text: Great! By the way, have you seen the sudden increase in error reports from the mobile app?
ipa: ɡreɪt! baɪ ðə weɪ, hæv ju sin ðə ˈsʌdən ˈɪnkris ɪn ˈɛrər rɪˈpɔrts frəm ðə ˈmoʊbəl æp?
stress: GREAT! By the WAY, have you SEEN the SUDDEN INCREASE in ERROR REPORTS from the MOBILE APP?
linking:
"have you" → /hæv ju/ (v + y linking)
"error reports" → /ˈɛrər rɪˈpɔrts/ (r + r linking)

speaker: Dana
text: Yeah. I heard about it from support. Apparently, something broke in the last release, and now users are complaining about login failures.
ipa: jæ. aɪ hɜrd əˈbaʊt ɪt frəm səˈpɔrt. əˈpɛrəntli, ˈsʌmθɪŋ broʊk ɪn ðə læst rɪˈlis, ənd naʊ ˈjuzərz ər kəmˈpleɪnɪŋ əˈbaʊt ˈlɔɡɪn ˈfeɪljərz.
stress: YEAH. I HEARD about it from SUPPORT. APPARENTLY, SOMETHING BROKE in the LAST RELEASE, and NOW USERS are COMPLAINING about LOGIN FAILURES.
linking:
"heard about" → /hɜrd əˈbaʊt/ (d + a linking)
"complaining about" → /kəmˈpleɪnɪŋ əˈbaʊt/ (g + a linking)

speaker: Marcus
text: We should definitely focus on that tomorrow. I’ll coordinate with QA and make sure it's prioritized.
ipa: wi ʃəd ˈdɛfənətli ˈfoʊkəs ɒn ðæt təˈmɑroʊ. aɪl koʊˈɔrdəˌneɪt wɪð ˈkjuːˈeɪ ənd meɪk ʃʊr ɪts praɪˈɔrəˌtaɪzd.
stress: We SHOULD DEFINITELY FOCUS on that TOMORROW. I’ll COORDINATE with QA and MAKE SURE it's PRIORITIZED.
linking:
"should definitely" → /ʃəd ˈdɛfənətli/ (d + d linking)
"coordinate with" → /koʊˈɔrdəˌneɪt wɪð/ (t + w linking)

speaker: Dana
text: Sounds good. I’ll also check with backend — just in case it’s related to the new auth token logic.
ipa: saʊndz ɡʊd. aɪl ˈɔlsoʊ tʃɛk wɪð ˈbækˌɛnd — dʒəst ɪn keɪs ɪts rɪˈleɪtɪd tu ðə nu ɔθ ˈtoʊkən ˈlɑdʒɪk.
stress: SOUNDS GOOD. I’ll ALSO CHECK with BACKEND — just in CASE it’s RELATED to the NEW AUTH TOKEN LOGIC.
linking:
"also check" → /ˈɔlsoʊ tʃɛk/ (o + ch linking)
"auth token" → /ɔθ ˈtoʊkən/ (th + t linking)
